description: Overall projection horizon
drivers: Covers pre-opening, construction, ramp-up and 3 years of operations

description: Base time step for projections
drivers: Supports detailed P&L and cash modeling; weekly for 13-week cash view
source_detail: Monthly with supplemental weekly cash for near-term

description: Available reporting granularities
drivers: Roll-ups for board, lenders, internal use
source_detail: Common practice to provide M/Q/Y views

description: Month construction begins
drivers: Depends on permits, financing close, contractor schedule
source_detail: Client plan to start around Jan 2026

description: Months from start to substantial completion
drivers: Determines timing of capex draw and opening
source_detail: Client estimate; aligned with typical small commercial build-outs

description: First partial operations
drivers: Assumes soft opening near end of construction

description: Full operations and marketing push begin
drivers: Depends on completion, inspections, stocking

description: Initial lease commitment horizon
drivers: Impacts rent obligations and renewal timing
source_detail: From signed lease; base period through mid-2028

description: Monthly base rent through mid-2028
drivers: Fixed by lease contract

description: Monthly base rent after renewal increase
drivers: Lease step-up clause

item_name: Share of property tax & building insurance
description: Tenant share of NNN charges
drivers: Determines share of building-level taxes and insurance
source_detail: Client responsible for ~25% of building’s tax & insurance

description: Modeled occupancy pass-through (NNN) as % of net sales
drivers: Back-calculated so total occupancy (rent+NNN) ? 2–4% of sales

description: Annual store-level insurance before opening
drivers: Covers liability, basic coverage while non-operating
source_detail: Client has ~$4k annual insurance until fully operational

description: Annual store-level insurance once store operates
drivers: Higher coverage for full operations, inventory, customers

description: Average monthly utilities during construction / pre-open
drivers: Light usage before refrigeration fully running
source_detail: Based on typical small commercial spaces

description: Monthly utilities cost per square foot in operation
drivers: Drives total utilities once store size known

description: Total expected cost for construction build-out
drivers: Primary build-out budget

description: Contingency % applied to hard costs
drivers: Covers overruns, change orders, inflation
source_detail: 10–15% contingency typical for small CRE projects

description: Design, permits, professional and other soft costs
drivers: Applied to construction_hard_cost_total

description: Refrigeration, shelving, POS, IT, carts, etc.
drivers: Required to open fully equipped supermarket

description: Total planned marketing spend before and at opening
drivers: Includes known $18k plus additional campaigns

description: Cash needed before operating cash flow turns positive
drivers: Covers inventory, initial payroll, rent, interest, other overhead
source_detail: Calculated from other assumptions and ramp profile

description: Policy for which pre-opening costs are capitalized
base_value: Capex construction & major soft; expense routine opex
drivers: Impacts depreciation and taxable income
source_detail: To be finalized with CPA based on GAAP/tax rules

description: Maximum principal available for construction financing
drivers: Covers hard costs plus some soft costs

description: Construction loan as % of total project cost
drivers: Determines max loan size relative to project cost
source_detail: Typical LTC range for small CRE construction

description: Annual interest rate during construction / I/O period
drivers: Applied to drawn balance, interest-only
source_detail: Within recent 7–10% range for small business construction loans

description: Months with interest-only payments
drivers: Covers full build plus early ramp-up

description: Rate on post-construction term loan
drivers: Depends on market, DSCR, collateral
source_detail: Conservative fixed rate for small CRE term loan

description: Amortization period for take-out loan
drivers: Impacts annual debt service and DSCR
source_detail: Common term for small CRE loans

description: Loan-to-value at take-out financing
drivers: Limited by DSCR and lender policy
source_detail: Typical stabilized LTV for bank loans

description: Total available shareholder/bridge capital
drivers: Existing $100k loan plus optional additional $100k

description: Rate on shareholder/bridge debt
drivers: Compensates risk of unsecured, subordinated funding

description: Tenor until bullet repayment or conversion
drivers: Sets timeline for exit or conversion to equity

description: Total consideration to acquire existing business
drivers: Includes cash at closing and seller note

description: Cash required at signing
drivers: Initial equity outlay or funded via financing

description: Portion of price financed by seller
drivers: Paid over 24 months with interest
source_detail: Balance of price payable over 2 years

description: Annual rate on seller financing
drivers: Fair compensation for seller over 24 months

description: Amortization period for seller financing
drivers: Defines monthly payment burden

description: Families in practical catchment area
drivers: Base for penetration and customer count
source_detail: Client indication of 500+ families; refined with research later

description: % of local households shopping primarily here in Year 1
drivers: Depends on competition and opening strategy
source_detail: Aggressive but realistic ramp for strong local concept

description: % of households in Year 2
drivers: Continued adoption and marketing

description: % of households in Year 3 and beyond
drivers: Represents mature share of local market
source_detail: Target share once store is established

description: Average visits per household per week
drivers: Drives transaction count

description: Average spend per visit in Year 1
drivers: Linked to income, positioning, specialty mix
source_detail: Consistent with mid- to high-end supermarket baskets

description: Annual real growth in basket size (excl. inflation)
drivers: Trading up, mix improvements

description: Management long-term revenue goal
drivers: Used to calibrate ramp and growth assumptions

description: Nominal annual sales growth after stabilization
drivers: Combination of real growth plus inflation

description: Relative index of monthly sales vs annual average
drivers: Reflects holiday peaks and slower months
source_detail: Initial pattern; refine with history from bought business

description: Gross profit as % of net sales
drivers: Depends on merchandising, pricing and vendor terms
source_detail: Client assumption of ~33% GM; within specialty range

description: Shrinkage as % of sales
drivers: Impacts effective COGS and profitability

description: Rebates and trade spend as % of sales
drivers: Reduces effective COGS, improves margin
source_detail: Based on common vendor support for volume retailers

description: Wages for store staff excl. benefits as % of sales
drivers: Major driver of operating margin

description: Employer taxes & benefits as % of wages
drivers: Adds on-cost to payroll lines

description: Routine marketing and promotions
drivers: Supports traffic growth and brand

description: Regular and unexpected maintenance
drivers: Linked to equipment age and intensity

description: Office supplies, bank fees, misc. overhead
drivers: Scales with store activity

description: Accounting, tax, legal, CFO retainers
drivers: Supports governance, compliance and advisory

description: POS, back-office software, cloud tools, security
drivers: Recurring SaaS and support costs

description: Average days of COGS held in inventory
drivers: Determines average inventory investment

description: Average days to pay suppliers (DPO)
drivers: Impacts working capital and cash conversion

description: Average days to collect receivables
drivers: Mostly card settlement and any house accounts

description: One-time inventory purchase before opening
drivers: Equals DIO × daily COGS at target run-rate
source_detail: Calculated from sales, margin and DIO

description: Combined federal/state effective rate on taxable income
drivers: Drives tax expense and net income
source_detail: To be refined with CPA based on structure

description: Max % of free cash flow available for distributions
drivers: Ensures debt service and reserves are prioritized
source_detail: Prudent payout ratio to preserve liquidity

description: Minimum months of opex to hold in cash reserves
drivers: Informs minimum cash and funding needs
source_detail: Aligns with comfort and risk tolerance

description: Annual capital reserve for future capex as % of sales
drivers: Funds replacements and upgrades over time
source_detail: Using 0.5–1.0% of sales for capital reserve

description: Target DSCR for loan compliance and safety
drivers: Impacts allowed debt load and distributions
source_detail: Common DSCR covenant for small business loans

description: Year 1 sales as % of long-term target in Build scenario
drivers: Reflects slow build of new brand

description: Year 2 sales as % of long-term target
drivers: Continued ramp-up as awareness grows
source_detail: Supports smooth approach to target revenue

description: Year 3 sales as % of long-term target
drivers: Assumes stabilization around Year 3

description: Initial annual revenue of acquired business
drivers: Baseline from target’s historicals
source_detail: To be replaced with actual P&L from seller

description: Initial gross margin of acquired business
drivers: Reflects current pricing and mix
source_detail: Replace with historical margin once available

description: Planned gross margin improvement over 2–3 years
drivers: From better sourcing, pricing, shrink control

description: % reduction in opex vs seller baseline
drivers: Levers: tech, staffing, procurement
source_detail: Synergy target with better management & systems

description: Annual inflation for non-food costs
drivers: Applied to many cost lines and some revenue

description: Annual wage growth
drivers: Reflects tight labor market and minimum wage trends

description: Annual inflation for COGS/food purchases
drivers: Affects COGS and possibly pricing
source_detail: To be cross-checked with USDA / industry forecasts

description: Discount rate for project NPV / feasibility
drivers: Reflects risk of single-store grocery startup
source_detail: Used in feasibility analysis and scenario comparison
